text:
DorMostSkazaniya claim that they did not declare a paid entry into the center of Astrakhan | WATERMELON
And have nothing to do with it

02 Nov 2019, 14:32


Main
Transport




Last Thursday, our publication, citing colleagues from Astrakhan.ru, reported on the development in Astrakhan of the Integrated Road Traffic Management Scheme (CSODD), as well as voiced related proposals. Among them were called the increase in the number of one-way streets and the possibility in the future to arrange paid entry into the center of Astrakhan.
On Friday evening, representatives of the company DorMostIzyskaniya, which is developing this very scheme, contacted us and reported that they did not call for paid entry into the central part of the city. We give it without any corrections.
‚ÄúInformation is disseminated in a number of mass media and social networks to which our company, which is developing the Astrakhan code system (integrated traffic management scheme), does not have a relationship. On October 25, we recorded an interview with the commercial director of our organization for one of the news resources in order to cut public opinions. During the conversation, a number of issues related to work on the CSODD were raised. In particular, it was about road safety, the work of traffic lights, the state of technical means of traffic management, passenger transport, bicycle infrastructure, etc. The main purpose of the interview was to attract respondents - residents of the city of Astrakhan - to the ongoing social survey, which is an integral part of the development of the KODOD. The experience of the development of the KODOD in other large cities was presented and reviewed. Also, proposals for improving the transport situation in Astrakhan were voiced. In order to unload the roads, opinions were expressed about the need for carriers to observe the timetable of fixed-route vehicles, about bringing the rolling stock of public transport to normative state, ‚Äùsaid Aleksandr Zheleznyak, Commercial Director of DorMostIzyskaniya LLC.
November 2, 2019, 18:32
SHARE NEWS
